title_full:
MYSTERY TIIME

            —
            MAUDIN TALES OF GRIEF (VICIOUS CHARM)

label: Ghostly International
description:
Peerless pop-not-slop artist Nathan Jenkins dons his Bullion bonnet for a uniquely gratifying 4th solo studio album, proper, nestling guest vox by Carly Rae Jepsen, Charlotte Adigéry, and Panda Bear in its pick ’n mix of exquisite confections, containing some of his most vulnerable songwriting and pitch-perfect, recombinant production ideas - RIYL Paddy McAloon, Scritti Politti, Junior Boys, Michel Turtle, Thomas Dolby, Godley & Creme.

Producer to some of this century’s most... more

Vanishing Twin

              —
              Life Drummer
            
              (Sub Pop Records)
label: Sub Pop Records
description:
Cathy Lucas’ post-punk-funk (and beyond) trio with Valentina Magaletti (Moin/Tomaga) and Susumu Yokai (Zongamin) channel Liquid Liquid, ESG and 23 Skidoo on a debut for Sub Pop, shifting from club-ready dancer ‘Life Drummer’ to more etheric Crepuscule suss on ‘Inarisan’, and the trippy, hobbled dub-noise ace ‘Non Guardare’

“Vanishing Twin was initially formed by the singer and multi-instrumentalist Cathy Lucas in 2015 and is now the tightly honed, London-based collective of Lucas... more

label: ESCHO
description:
Danish composer Astrid Sonne opens up her heart on 'Great Doubt', singing candidly for the first time over powdery beats and jerky instrumentation (assisted by none other than Slauson Malone, Ben Vince, Levitation Orchestra's Emma Barnaby and Alvilda Reiter Jakobsen), and even referencing Mariah Carey. It's a revelation - and funny in places too - properly in line with Tirzah, ML Buch and HTRK.

We almost didn't recognize Sonne when we first spun 'Great Doubt'. Her voice - not her viola... more

title_full:
ANGRY BLACKMAN

            —

MOSCA

            —
            THE ROPE BEGINS TO FRAY (RENT)

label: Matador
description:
With over four decades of relentless reinvention and innovation under her belt, Kim Gordon embraces failure on her mind-boggling latest solo LP, rapping and groaning over industrialized, hybrid trap beats that push so far into the red they almost disintegrate. Where a lesser presence could have let that production dominate, Gordon is always the total focus of our attention, the rhythm - as sick as it is - functions almost like a stock backing track, such is her shine. Essential gear.

We should have... more

title_full:
Brokenchord

              —
              Stone Island Tracks
            
              (South Of North)
label: South Of North
description:
Laid-back and breezy, post punk, leftfield psych-soul, dub and electronica-skooled grooves by Lithuanian Ernestas Kausylas.

"‘Stone Island Tracks’ is the follow-up to Brokenchord’s ‘Endless Transmission’ album of 2017. he’s previously remixed Radiohead. The seven cuts are dusted and easy going, following his nose for languid offbeat strut and subtly lysergic guitar and synth tone from the baggy schwag of ‘Weather Report’ thru an ace bit of dubby steppers’ motion in the title tune, where his... more

label: imbalance computer music
description:
On his tenth Monolake album, Robert Henke memorialises his forensic creative process, revising old sketches and dusting off some of his favorite hardware synths to create a lengthy set of sci-fi tinged electroid experiments.

Ten albums in and Robert Henke's still in his own lane, even after inspiring countless copyists. So it's high time for the producer to inventory his process, which he deconstructs in great detail on 'Studio'. His studio is his shelter, he admits, and the place where he's free to... more

label: Accidental Meetings
description:
Bristol’s haunted bassbins beam the debut 7” by local hero Yokel, an alum of Avon Terror Corps and Bokeh Versions, dancing between dungeon synf and tart coldwave industrial for Accidental Meetings

‘4.A.M.’ fathoms the spectrum of Yokel’s style in 2023 after a debut album ‘Smell of Deer’ deposited on Avon Terror Corps in 2020 and jams with Franco Franco and numerous compilation cuts in recent years. ‘M3D’ pitches him in eldritch back country with gloomy chamber synth motifs subtly... more

release: i don't care if anyone listens to this shit once you do
title_full:
pigbaby

              —
              i don't care if anyone listens to this shit once you do
            
              (PLZ Make It Ruins)
label: PLZ Make It Ruins
description:
Pigbaby’s debut album for Vegyn’s label is a triumph of DIY, dare-to-differ songcraft that simply sounds like nobody else. Nasal poems and vaulted falsettos appear to shapeshift in/out of focus amid a drowsy melange of styles associated to ambient, folk, cloudrap and contemporary blooz, but beholden to none.

On radars since 2022’s ‘Palindromes’ snagged underground ears, pigbaby has emerged among his gen’s most enigmatic with a sound that could be roughly compared to the lo-fi styles of... more

label: International Anthem
description:
West Coast jazz quintet SML's debut album is a heady, psychedelic study of raw grooves that takes its frenetic pulse from a diverse array of influences - everyone from Miles Davis, Herbie Hancock and Fela Kuti to Pole, Susumu Yokota and Can.

Made up of bassist Anna Butterss, synth player Jeremiah Chiu, saxophonist Josh Johnson, drummer Booker Stardrum and guitarist Gregory Uhlmann, SML are talented musicians in their own right, but the improvisations on show here are far greater... more

DUCKETT

            —
            READ BETWEEN THE LINES (ACCIDENTAL RECORDS)

label: Soulsheriff Records
description:
Yeah, you’re not seeing things. Electronic body musick’s near-mythical ground zero is finally issued in its entirety, expanding the 9 known cuts of 1981 with no fewer than 11 never-before-heard jams from the same sessions. Take a second to drink that in, then pounce if you know what’s good! E-S-S-E-N-T-I-A-L RIYL Liaisons Dangereuses, Einstürzende Neubauten, DAF, Chris Carter…!!!!!!!

As legend has it, Düsseldorf’s Chrislo Haas & Beate Bartel laid the blueprint for EBM with their fateful studio... more

label: XL Recordings
description:
New album 'Cutouts' from The Smile, on XL Recordings.

"The trio - Thom Yorke, Jonny Greenwood and Tom Skinner - debuted several songs from Cutouts during The Smile’s UK tour in March. Cutouts features 10 new-tracks and is produced by Sam Petts-Davies. It’s the band’s third studio album following Wall of Eyes, released in January, and the trio’s 2022 debut album A Light For Attracting Attention. Cutoutswas recorded in Oxford and at Abbey Road Studios during the same period of... more

label: WRWTFWW Records
description:
Timeless ambient electronica with a frisson of jazzy exotica, puckered onto vinyl by Geneva’s WRWTFWW Records after its ’21 tape edition with Miami’s Schematic.

Also regarded as half of Cologne, who’ve previously worked with LA Vampires and LA’s Memory No.36 (Maxwell Sterling), Danny Scott Lane has spent the past five years hatching a balmy downbeat solo sound that led him to WRWTFWW Records with ’Shower’ in 2023. The label now scroll back a little to give this one the vinyl shine... more

artist: Jeff Parker and ETA IVtet featuring Anna Butterss, Jay Bellerose and Josh Johnson
title_full:
Jeff Parker and ETA IVtet featuring Anna Butterss, Jay Bellerose and Josh Johnson

              —
              The Way Out of Easy
            
              (International Anthem)
label: International Anthem
description:
Recorded at LA's recently shuttered ETA, 'The Way Out of Easy' is a celebration of iconic guitarist Jeff Parker's seven year residency alongside Anna Butterss, Jay Bellerose and Josh Johnson, touching on the weekly sessions' transcendent, groove-fwd hybridity with canny nods to post-rock, kosmische, hip-hop and dub.

For decades at this point, Parker has been restlessly innovating both as a soloist and a keen collaborator, working with formative post-rock outfits like Isotope 217... more
